What is Android?: It is an open-sourced operating system that is used primarily on mobile devices, such as cell phones and tablets.
What Is the Google Android SDK?: The Google Android SDK is a toolset that developers need in order to write apps on Android enabled devices.
What is the Android Architecture?: Android Architecture is made up of 4 key components: Linux Kernel, Libraries, Android Framework, Android Applications
What is AAPT?: AAPT is short for Android Asset Packaging Tool.
What is the importance of having an emul: The emulator lets developers “play” around an interface that acts as if it were an actual mobile device.
